text: The giant antshrike (Batara cinerea) is a species of bird in the Thamnophilidae family. It belongs to the genus Batara. It is found in Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, and Paraguay. This species is the largest species of antbird, measuring 34 cm long and weighing around 150 g. Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical forests. ==References== * BirdLife International 2004. Batara cinerea. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 25 July 2007. ==Other websites== *Image at ADW Category:Tyranni Category:Birds of South America
title: Giant antshrike
